analysisVariables.description: Unique numerical representation of SITEID. The numeric versions of the primary/character variables can be assigned from its corresponding character pair variable.
analysisVariables.label: Study Site Identifier (N)
analysisVariables.name: SITEIDN

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis

parentProduct.title: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis

analysisVariables.description: Derived sequence for the whole dataset. Sequential values should start with 1 on the first non-header row of the data file (i.e., skipping the variable names) and incrementing by 1 for each subsequent row. These are basically row numbers. It is often used for convenience purposes and merging of PK and PD datasets. It can also be useful for the tracking of outlier exclusion, since the variable is preserved from the original to the final dataset.
analysisVariables.label: Record Sequence
analysisVariables.name: RECSEQ

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis

parentProduct.title: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis

self.title: Actual Rel Time from First Dose

analysisVariables.description: Actual elapsed time (for sample point or start of sampling interval) from first exposure to study treatment. Could be negative. Derived from (ADTM of the current event/record of the subject) - (ADTM of the first dosing event/record of the subject).
analysisVariables.label: Actual Rel Time from First Dose
analysisVariables.name: AFRLT

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis

parentProduct.title: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis

analysisVariables.description: Units for all reference times AFRLT, APRLT, NFRLT, NPRLT. Add the unit here or in the time variable label.
analysisVariables.label: Relative Time Unit
analysisVariables.name: RLTU

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis

parentProduct.title: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis

self.title: Actual Rel Time from Previous Dose

analysisVariables.description: Derived from (ADTM of the current event/record of the subject) - (ADTM of the previous dosing event/record of the subject).
analysisVariables.label: Actual Rel Time from Previous Dose
analysisVariables.name: APRLT

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis

parentProduct.title: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis

self.title: Nominal Rel Time from First Dose

analysisVariables.description: Planned elapsed time (for sample point or start of sampling interval) from first exposure to study treatment. For PK it will be in the PC dataset.
analysisVariables.label: Nominal Rel Time from First Dose
analysisVariables.name: NFRLT

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis

parentProduct.title: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis

self.title: Nominal Rel Time from Previous Dose

analysisVariables.description: For PK it can be derived from "planned elapsed time (for sample point or start of sampling interval) from reference exposure to study treatment" or equivalent variable that has nominal time in the PC dataset.
analysisVariables.label: Nominal Rel Time from Previous Dose
analysisVariables.name: NPRLT

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis

parentProduct.title: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis

analysisVariables.description: Occasion is a grouping variable. It groups dose and concentration observations for a particular dosing. The implementation is taken directly from the specs/protocol and defined by the modeler. This is a popPK software variable.
analysisVariables.label: Occasion
analysisVariables.name: OCC

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis

parentProduct.title: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis

analysisVariables.description: It can be captured prior to the modeling or after some analysis, with possible iterations and adjustments. Some possible reasons: BLOQ, biological implausibility, IWER > threshold, incorrect dosing information. There can be several reasons for flagging data during the dataset creation (e.g., day 1 pre-dose samples, missing sample information, deviation of actual time from nominal time > threshold).
analysisVariables.label: Record Exclusion
analysisVariables.name: EXCLF

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis

parentProduct.title: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis

analysisVariables.description: It can be captured prior to the modeling or after some analysis, with possible iterations and adjustments. Some possible reasons: BLOQ, biological implausibility, outlier based on variability metrics, incorrect dosing information, day 1 pre-dose sample. This can also be coded through numbers that are connected with different reasons. Based on data specification. Could come from multiple sources (e.g., SDTM or ADaM source, CRITyFN variable). Examples of exclusions can be found in Section 3.4, Standard Flags and Record Identifiers in Population PK Dataset.
analysisVariables.label: Comment for the Record Exclusion
analysisVariables.name: EXCLFCOM

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis

parentProduct.title: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis

analysisVariables.description: Captures primary reason for identifying the record for data issues (e.g., dose time imputation flags). A sequential number starting with 1 and increments with each unique reason. Examples of reasons for identification of data issue can be found in Section 3.4, Standard Flags and Record Identifiers in Population PK Dataset.
analysisVariables.label: Identification of Data Issue Reason
analysisVariables.name: FLGREAS

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis

parentProduct.title: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis

analysisVariables.description: Character version of FLGREAS.
analysisVariables.label: Identification of Data Issue Reason (C)
analysisVariables.name: FLGREASC

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis

parentProduct.title: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis

analysisVariables.description: EVID=1 is Dosing Event, EVID=0 is observation. \n It can be expanded to other numbers as defined in the dataset specs. This is a popPK software variable.
analysisVariables.label: Event ID
analysisVariables.name: EVID

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis

parentProduct.title: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis

analysisVariables.description: Analyte/drug name/other measurements (e.g., PC.PCTEST for PK, EX or ADEX for dose, ADLB for labs).
analysisVariables.label: Dependent Variable Name
analysisVariables.name: DVID

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis

parentProduct.title: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis

analysisVariables.description: Unique numerical representation of DVID. Convention is normally 0=dose, 1=for the first observation of interest, etc. The numeric versions of the primary/character variables can be assigned from its corresponding character pair variable.
analysisVariables.label: Dependent Variable Name (N)
analysisVariables.name: DVIDN

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis

parentProduct.title: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis

analysisVariables.description: Derived based on the specifications from modeler. This is a popPK software variable.
analysisVariables.label: Compartment
analysisVariables.name: CMT

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis

parentProduct.title: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis

analysisVariables.description: Numeric result of dependent variable applicable to observation events. DV is a widely used notation in the field of pharmacometrics since its inception for the value of dependent variable (observation). This is a copy of AVAL.
analysisVariables.label: Dependent Variable Result
analysisVariables.name: DV

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis

parentProduct.title: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis

analysisVariables.description: Numeric analysis value described by PARAM.
analysisVariables.label: Analysis Value
analysisVariables.name: AVAL

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis

parentProduct.title: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis

analysisVariables.description: Unit for DV and AVAL
analysisVariables.label: Dependent Variable Unit
analysisVariables.name: AVALU

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis

parentProduct.title: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis

self.title: Result or Finding in Standard Format

analysisVariables.description: Character results/findings of dependent variable in a standard format. The purpose of this column is to capture which records are BLQ or ALQ in the DV column; for example, PC.PCSTRESC (SDTM), AVAL (ADaM). U is a replacement for the dataset name from where the value came from (e.g., USTRESC is equal to PCSTRESC for PC records).
analysisVariables.label: Result or Finding in Standard Format
analysisVariables.name: USTRESC

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis

parentProduct.title: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis

analysisVariables.description: If DV= . then MDV=1. \n (When DV is missing for observation then MDV=1, when EVID=1 then MDV=1) \n This is a popPK software variable.
analysisVariables.label: Missing Dependent Variable Result
analysisVariables.name: MDV

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis

parentProduct.title: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis

analysisVariables.description: In assay report
analysisVariables.label: Analysis Upper Limit of Quantitation
analysisVariables.name: AULOQ

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis

parentProduct.title: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis

analysisVariables.description: LLOQ of PK, PD and any other sources
analysisVariables.label: Analysis Lower Limit of Quantitation
analysisVariables.name: ALLOQ

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis

parentProduct.title: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis

self.title: Below Lower Limit of Quant Flag

analysisVariables.description: N, Y. Set to Y when the analysis value is below the limit of quantification.
analysisVariables.label: Below Lower Limit of Quant Flag
analysisVariables.name: BLQFL

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis

parentProduct.title: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis

self.title: Below Lower Limit of Quant Flag (N)

analysisVariables.description: 0=N, 1=Y. The numeric versions of the primary/character variables can be assigned from its corresponding character pair variable.
analysisVariables.label: Below Lower Limit of Quant Flag (N)
analysisVariables.name: BLQFN

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis

parentProduct.title: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis

self.title: Above the Upper Limit of Quant Flag

analysisVariables.description: N, Y. Set to Y when the analysis value is above the limit of quantification.
analysisVariables.label: Above the Upper Limit of Quant Flag
analysisVariables.name: ALQFL

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis

parentProduct.title: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis

self.title: Above the Upper Limit of Quant Flag (N)

analysisVariables.description: 0=N, 1=Y. The numeric versions of the primary/character variables can be assigned from its corresponding character pair variable.
analysisVariables.label: Above the Upper Limit of Quant Flag (N)
analysisVariables.name: ALQFN

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis

parentProduct.title: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis

analysisVariables.description: Only populated on dosing records
analysisVariables.label: Actual Amount of Dose Received (unit)
analysisVariables.name: AMT

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis

parentProduct.title: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis

analysisVariables.description: DOSEA represents the actual treatment dosage associated with the record. Could be amount (mg) or weight based dose (mg/kg). Units of AMT and DOSEA can be same or different. \n This is the actual numeric amount of the dose used for the population analysis and may differ from the EX.EXDOSE. It can be derived from the EX.EXDOSE or based on related dose. Populated on all individual records as carry-forward.
analysisVariables.label: Actual Treatment Dose (unit)
analysisVariables.name: DOSEA

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis

parentProduct.title: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis

self.title: Total Daily Amt of Dose Received (unit)

analysisVariables.description: Used mostly for BID dosing schemes
analysisVariables.label: Total Daily Amt of Dose Received (unit)
analysisVariables.name: DOSETDD

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis

parentProduct.title: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis

analysisVariables.description: Duration associated with infusion (IV, SC); distinct from TRTDURD, TRTDURM, and TRTDURY, which reference the duration of the entire study rather than the duration of a single treatment event. "EX dataset". \n Derived from EXENDTC - EXSTDTC \n The label should contain the unit of time. Usually same unit as time variables.
analysisVariables.label: Duration Of Dose Administration (unit)
analysisVariables.name: DOSEDUR

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis

parentProduct.title: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis

analysisVariables.description: Calculated as the amount of dose received divided by the dose duration. Certain modeling methods may require that RATE is set to a specific value. \n The label should contain the unit (e.g., mg/hr).
analysisVariables.label: Infusion Rate (unit)
analysisVariables.name: RATE

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis

parentProduct.title: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis

analysisVariables.description: Describes the dosing frequency for multiple doses (e.g., 24 for QD, 12 for BID, if time unit is hours).
analysisVariables.label: Dosing Interval (unit)
analysisVariables.name: II

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis

parentProduct.title: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis

analysisVariables.description: Number of additional doses like the current dosing event until the next captured dose (e.g., if the value is 1 then 1 additional dose; if value is 2 then 2 additional doses). It is commonly used for long-lasting studies with frequent dosing in order to not have the dataset extremely large.
analysisVariables.label: Number Of Additional Doses
analysisVariables.name: ADDL

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis

parentProduct.title: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis

analysisVariables.description: A steady-state dose is a dose that is presumed to be the last of a series of implied doses, each exactly like the dose in question, given at a regular interval specified by the II data item and leading to steady state by the time the steady-state dose is given.
analysisVariables.label: Steady State
analysisVariables.name: SS

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66726

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis

parentProduct.title: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis

analysisVariables.description: Type of formulation (e.g., tablet, capsule, aerosol); EX.EXDOSFRM or protocol
analysisVariables.label: Drug Formulation
analysisVariables.name: FORM

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis

parentProduct.title: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis

analysisVariables.description: Unique numerical representation of FORM. The numeric versions of the primary/character variables can be assigned from the corresponding character pair variable.
analysisVariables.label: Drug Formulation (N)
analysisVariables.name: FORMN

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66729

analysisVariables.description: Route of treatment delivery. May be derived from EX.EXROUTE.
analysisVariables.label: Route of Administration
analysisVariables.name: ROUTE

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis

parentProduct.title: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis

analysisVariables.description: Derived from ROUTE as one-on-one unique match. The numeric versions of the primary/character variables can be assigned from its corresponding character pair variable.
analysisVariables.label: Route of Administration (N)
analysisVariables.name: ROUTEN

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis

parentProduct.title: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis

analysisVariables.description: Record-level identifier that reflects cycle and may be of particular importance for studies that examine concentrations in cancer patients from AVISIT or protocol.
analysisVariables.label: Analysis Cycle
analysisVariables.name: ACYCLE

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis

parentProduct.title: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis

analysisVariables.description: Derived from ACYCLE as one-on-one unique match. The character versions of the primary/character variables can be assigned from its corresponding numeric pair variable.
analysisVariables.label: Analysis Cycle (C)
analysisVariables.name: ACYCLEC

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis

parentProduct.title: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis

analysisVariables.description: Subject-level variable. Could be some sort of subpopulation.
analysisVariables.label: Cohort Subject Enrolled Into
analysisVariables.name: COHORT

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis

parentProduct.title: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis

analysisVariables.description: Character representation of the COHORT variable. There must be a one-to-one mapping to COHORT. The character versions of the primary/character variables can be assigned from its corresponding numeric pair variable.
analysisVariables.label: Cohort Subject Enrolled into (C)
analysisVariables.name: COHORTC

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis

parentProduct.title: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis

self.title: Date and Time of the Event

analysisVariables.description: Datetime associated with event ID represented in ISO 8601 character format. U is a replacement for the dataset name from where the value came from (e.g., UDTC is equal to PCDTC for PC records).
analysisVariables.label: Date and Time of the Event
analysisVariables.name: UDTC

self.title: ADPPK Population Pharmacokinetics Analysis Variables - Covariates

parentVariableSet.title: ADPPK Population Pharmacokinetics Analysis Variables - Covariates

analysisVariables.description: Variable may be derived from VS.VSTEST and VS.VSSTRESN but may also be pulled in from other datasets. Weight is associated with sampling time. SDTM.VS or a Vital Signs analysis dataset.
analysisVariables.label: Body Weight (unit)
analysisVariables.name: WT

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis

parentProduct.title: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis

parentVariableSet.title: ADPPK Population Pharmacokinetics Analysis Variables - Covariates

analysisVariables.description: Variable may be derived from VS.VSTEST and VS.VSSTRESN but may also be pulled in from other datasets. Weight is associated with the last assessment prior to dosing. Use flags for baseline. SDTM.VS or a Vital Signs analysis dataset. If the definition of this variable in the modeling plan is the same as in the SAP then use the variable in ADSL.
analysisVariables.label: Baseline Body Weight (unit)
analysisVariables.name: WTBL

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis

parentProduct.title: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis

parentVariableSet.title: ADPPK Population Pharmacokinetics Analysis Variables - Covariates

analysisVariables.description: Variable may be derived from baseline VS.VSTEST and VS.VSSTRESN but may also be pulled in from other datasets. SDTM.VS or a Vital Signs analysis dataset. If the definition of this variable in the modeling plan is the same as in the statistical analysis plan (SAP), then use the variable in ADSL.
analysisVariables.label: Baseline Body Height (unit)
analysisVariables.name: HTBL

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis

parentProduct.title: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis

parentVariableSet.title: ADPPK Population Pharmacokinetics Analysis Variables - Covariates

analysisVariables.description: Variable may be derived from baseline VS.VSTEST and VS.VSSTRESN but may also be pulled in from other datasets (SDTM.VS or a Vital Signs analysis dataset) or derived. ADSL.BMIBL for baseline and VS.BMI for time-varying or derived. If the definition of this variable in the modeling plan is the same as in the SAP then use the variable in ADSL.
analysisVariables.label: Baseline Body Mass Index (unit)
analysisVariables.name: BMIBL

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis

parentProduct.title: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis

parentVariableSet.title: ADPPK Population Pharmacokinetics Analysis Variables - Covariates

analysisVariables.description: Variable may be derived from baseline VS.VSTEST and VS.VSSTRESN but may also be pulled in from other datasets (SDTM.VS or a Vital Signs analysis dataset) or derived. ADSL.BSABL for baseline and VS.BSA for time-varying or derived. If the definition of this variable in the modeling plan is the same as in the SAP then use the variable in ADSL.
analysisVariables.label: Body Surface Area at Baseline (unit)
analysisVariables.name: BSABL

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis

parentProduct.title: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis

analysisVariables.description: DM.AGE or ADSL.AGE. If analysis needs require a derived age that does not match ADSL.AGE, then AAGE (Analysis Age) must be added.

analysisVariables.description: Number of years between BRTHDT and ADT
analysisVariables.label: Age at Analysis Timepoint (unit)
analysisVariables.name: AGETPT

analysisVariables.description: The race of the subject is a required variable in ADSL; identical to ADSL.RACE. May categorize differently if analysis demands.
analysisVariables.label: Race
analysisVariables.name: RACE

parentDatastructure.title: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis

parentVariableSet.title: ADPPK Population Pharmacokinetics Analysis Variables - Covariates

analysisVariables.description: Numeric version of RACE, e.g., codes used as per the specification. \n 1=American Indian or Alaska Native, 2=Asian, 3=Black/African American, 4=Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander, 5=White \n If races need to be categorized differently, then use variables ARACE and ARACEN.
analysisVariables.label: Race (N)
analysisVariables.name: RACEN

analysisVariables.description: To be able to allow different definitions of race. For example, allowing to code American Indian/Alaska Native and Native Hawaiian/Other Pacific Islander are coded as "Other". This is analysis-specific and could vary based on analysis needs.
analysisVariables.label: Analysis Race
analysisVariables.name: ARACE

parentProduct.title: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis

analysisVariables.description: Numeric version of ARACE; for example: \n 1=White, 2=Black/African American, 3=Asian, 4=Other, 5=Unknown (e.g., not reported). American Indian/Alaska Native and Native Hawaiian/Other Pacific Islander are coded as 4.
analysisVariables.label: Analysis Race (N)
analysisVariables.name: ARACEN

dataStructures.description: Dataset designed to support PPK. Sourced from SDTM (e.g., PC, DM, EX, LB) and ADaM (e.g., ADSL and ADEX datasets).
dataStructures.label: Basic Data Structure Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis
dataStructures.name: ADPPK

description: The purpose of this document is to present the ADaM Basic Data Structure (BDS) and required extensions for popPK. The ADaM Implementation Guide (ADaMIG) supports many of the variables needed for popPK analysis and provides general naming conventions that can be leveraged in the definition of other variables. The ADaM popPK Implementation Guide provides specific guidance for all common variables and may be viewed as the ADaM BDS model plus additional popPK variables.
label: Basic Data Structure for Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Analysis
name: ADaM popPK v1.0
source: ADaM Population Pharmacokinetic (popPK) Standards Development Team
